hero.heading: Enforce policy as code for HashiCorp products

overview.heading: What is Sentinel?
overview.body: Sentinel is a policy as code tool that lets you control what users of HashiCorp products are allowed to do. It enforces policies proactively, preventing end users from deploying changes that aren't allowed.

get_started.heading: Getting Started
get_started.body: Write and run your first example Sentinel policies.

cards.heading: Infrastructure
cards.body: Use Terraform Cloud with Sentinel to check that infrastructure will comply with policies.

cards.heading: Security
cards.body: Use Vault with Sentinel to control who can access secrets based on their role or the endpoint.

cards.heading: Applications
cards.body: Use Nomad with Sentinel to control jobs based on driver or other attributes of the job object.

cards.heading: Sentinel playground
cards.body: Write and test your own Sentinel policies in a free, hosted sandbox. Upload your own mock data to write policies against, or customize the provided example, which checks that an S3 bucket has a private ACL.
